Multipurpose halls, sports, canteen, and transportation are all available, as well well-equipped library with a sufficient quantity of course books and reference books

Master in Business Studies [MBS] is a postgraduate business study degree of 2 years which is divided into 4 semesters of study, 2 semesters each year. The Master of Business Studies degree program combines the study of advanced theory with research.

Bachelor of Business Management or BBM is a three-year undergraduate management programme that facilitates specialization in different areas of study. This programme aims to help students acquaint themselves with managerial and decision-making skills. BBM programme can be pursued by the candidates after completion of class 12 in any stream.
The term BCA stands for Bachelor of Computer Applications. A three-year undergraduate degree in technology and computer applications is known as a Bachelor of Computer Applications (BCA)

patterns: what types of bim course is?
responses: The Bachelor of Information Management (BIM) program is a four-year (eight-semester) program of Tribhuvan University offering integrated IT and Management Courses.
Bachelor of Information Management (BIM) is a four years degree launched by Tribhuvan University under Faculty of Management. BIM course is a blend of IT and Management.

Bachelor of Business studies (BBS) is the four year degree program conducted by Tribhuvan University (TU), faculty of Management (FOM). It is an annual exam based program. The main objective of BBS is to develop students into dynamic managers having ability to handle responsibility in every sector.

Bachelors of Science in Computer Science and Information Technology (B.Sc. CSIT) is a four year course affiliated to Tribhuvan University designed to provide the students with all sorts of knowledge in the field of Information Technology and Computing.

Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA) is a bachelor's degree in business administration awarded by colleges and universities after completion of undergraduate study in the fundamentals of business administration and usually including advanced courses in accounting, economics, finance, management, marketing, strategic management, supply chain management, and other key academic subjects associated with the academic discipline of business management.

patterns: What are the procedure for admission?
responses: Student must fill up entrance form and take the entrance exam conducted by Tribhuvan University. If student passes the entrance, he/she will be eligible for interview. After students are approved from interview ,then they can submit their admission fee in account section and submit other required documents in administration section

After entrance exam ,First you are called for interview. Within 2-3 days of interview you should submit admission fee based on availability of seats because the seats are filled by the procedure of First Come First Basis Admission

After entrance exam ,You will be called for an interview first. Within 2-3 days of the interview, you must submit an admission fee based on seat availability, as seats are filled on a first-come, first-served basis
